title: 烏鴉嘴
explain: 烏鴉嘴，或是帶來壞運氣的人或東西
ex2:
Don’t say we’re going to win.
You’ll jinx it!
tran2: 別說我們一定會贏，你會烏鴉嘴
ex3: He's a jinx—everything he touches breaks.
tran3: 他帶賽，他碰的東西都壞掉

title: 自費
ex1: I'll have to pay out of pocket for the repairs.
tran1: 我得自掏腰包付修理費
ex2: I was out of pocket covering the medical bill.
ex3: If it's minor, pay out of pocket and skip insurance.
tran3: 如果是小問題，就自掏腰包付錢，不走保險理賠

title: 哽咽
explain: 感動或難過到聲音卡住、哽咽，講不下去
ex1: I always choke up during that song.
tran1: 我每次聽到那首歌都會哽咽
ex2: She choked up when she saw the letter.
tran2: 她看到那封信時哽咽了
ex3: He chokes up at every goodbye.

title: 退步
explain: 曾經很會，現在手感差了，有點退步
ex1: I think I'm starting to lose my touch.
tran1: 我覺得我開始有點退步了
ex2: He's definitely beginning to lose his touch lately.
tran2: 他最近確實開始退步了
ex3: She's scared she'll lose her touch without practice.
tran3: 她擔心如果不練習會退步

title: 被劈腿了
explain: 被劈腿了，感情被背叛整個人超受傷
ex1: I got cheated on last month.
ex2: She got cheated on by her boyfriend.
ex3: He just found out he got cheated on.
tran3: 他剛發現自己被劈腿了

title: 佔位子
explain: 在旁邊放東西佔位子，替別人保留座位或排隊位置
ex1: Can you hold a seat for me?
ex2: I'll hold a seat while you grab coffee.
tran2: 我會佔位子，你去拿咖啡
ex3: Hold a seat—I'll be right back.
tran3: 幫我佔位子—我馬上回來

title: 顧個東西的「顧」
explain: 盯著看、注意或照顧某物或某人，像是在顧個東西的「顧」
ex1: Can you keep an eye on my bag?
tran1: 你可以幫我顧一下包嗎？
ex2: I'll keep an eye on the kids.
ex3: Keep an eye on the oven, please.

title: 穩交
explain: 跟某人正式交往、感情穩定，就是所謂的穩交
tran1: 我們在大學時期一直穩交
ex2: I don't want to go steady right now.
ex3: Do you think they'll go steady soon?
tran3: 你覺得他們很快會穩交嗎？

title: 贅肉
explain: 就是身上多餘、鬆軟會晃動的贅肉，常見在小腹、手臂、腰際
ex1: I need to get rid of my flab.
ex2: These jeans hide my flab perfectly.
tran2: 這條牛仔褲完美地遮住我的贅肉
ex3: Her arm flab jiggles when she waves.
tran3: 她揮手時手臂的贅肉會晃動

title: 起水泡
explain: 皮膚被摩擦或燙傷而起水泡，常常又痛又癢
ex1: If you walk too long you'll get a blister
tran1: 如果你走太久會起水泡
ex2: Don't run too long or you'll get a blister
tran2: 別跑太久，不然你會起水泡
ex3: I always get a blister from new shoes
tran3: 我穿新鞋總是會起水泡

title: 被冷落
explain: 被排除在團體或活動之外，感覺被冷落、孤單又沒被重視
ex1: I don't want to be left out.
ex2: She felt like she would be left out.
ex3: Don't make me be left out, please.
